gCTrwxcByNegEmUnZX4Svg.text: Place is alright. Website shows a different picture than real life. Igloos didn't impress me either. Hostess had terrible customer service. If you're looking for nice romantic dinner, this isn't it. Plenty of other places in London that are more romantic.

J586w-M7aj9At44U5WZ8ig.text: The service was amazing. The host was very pleasant and our waiter was as well. We ordered 2 pizzas, a burger and a few small bites, all were delicious. The soup was especially good! Would absolutely go back.

UqXL3nX6IA4FDvBy_r4Cug.text: Disgustingly greasy. Do not order the burger or pizza. Burger buns soggy and dripping and the pizza was swimming in grease- completely non edible. Visit the nearby subway for a much better meal.

CmaSGdoDxrBvWEdPo2avng.text: This place is all atmosphere with no quality food based on what we had. Very disappointing to say the least. The "crack and avacado" appetizer was not edible, it was actually hummus with a couple of chunks of avacado, but also tasted like those oily smoked oysters in a can that have sat out in the sun too long. I hope we didn't get food poisoning. The staff was great, the location very cool. The pizza was a joke!

KrrsYegR6DOgzqCkBIdzng.text: Loved the evening ambiance and decor, but didn't enjoy the food. We ordered bruschetta which was horrible, prawns which were surprisingly good, and an unimpressive salad and pizza. Would go back again for the drinks but not the food.

vs5DIz5jK-Kg7XlquheI8Q.text: Girlfriend dragged me along for my 37th birthday. Food was nice location very nice and the mad pods outside looked like a good experience. Would I be back I hear all my fans screaming ??? Well I don't know. Maybe I will maybe I won't. I like to leave you lovely sexy people guessing. Xx

evS-XkXLHHgQnCmFy4PM7g.text: It took a little bit longer to have all of the foods out. We were not happy with it, but the manager came out and have a good reason for it with his apologize and free foods for 6 of us. That's acceptable. Good taking care of customers.

1U6NSTDtOCWn8f3kHFjBHg.text: Nice outdoor eating atmosphere, fun to people watch but the food was way disappointing! I ordered Halibut but I got Salmon! It was good but still you can't just switch out the fish for another!! They tried to tell me it was halibut but the table next to us ordered the same thing and agreed it was salmon!!  My husband's crab dish looked like mush in thousand island dressing and he couldn't even eat it - smelled too fishy. Service was fine.

pMAAyh3CJFqfIZdSfxeFNQ.text: As a new addition to the scene I was surprised at the lack of accommodation. It's never good to experience being turned away as a potential patron. Sadly, this was my experience recently when looking to book this venue for a large group. As host of corporate executives, business people and various community members there could have been an opportunity to shine for future bookings alas we were not afforded that opportunity. I cannot report on table service or quality, however the venue looked lovely inside, the facilities were clean and the outdoor space was beautiful. I was told it was being redesigned so looks like they'll have something new soon. Maybe it's great for dinner or drinks for two, but I can tell you they're not interested in large groups, y'all.

fZiZ9dYRe5uhNFQ9SIIWZQ.text: Great view with excellent appetizers and delicious tea! Outside seating area is beautiful . We enjoyed it a lot!

Av6Es5E9KPKSEVXqHS5hbQ.text: Excellent carbonara and cocktails, situated in an superb location and the staff were extremely helpful. The food was quick and brilliant value for money, will definitely be back on my next visit to London.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Prosecco & elderberry cocktail
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Carbonara

Z8oO5S9mEoO_ujZr7XU9nA.text: Outstanding Italian themed food - 4 of us, including our 2 children. The restaurant has a nice clean classic vibe with upbeat music and an outstanding, warm service team.  My son ordered the pizza which was excellent, a perfect thin crust, and right amount of cheese. My daughter has tortellini with mint and pine nuts. Fresh and not drowned in heavy sauce. My wife had the Cornish hen, also tasty. I had the sea trout. I found it fresh and not over cooked. It had a fennel and cous cous side which was excellent. The side salad was outstanding too, with an amazing dressing. Also had a side of fresh veggies, which was kale with garlic and chili. Finally my wife and I shared the Panna cotta. Also not overly sweet and really creamy. The kids had hot chocolate, which yet again was well done and not overly sweet. What can I say.  For me it hit all the right points:  nice, comfortable, clean environment, nice music, great service and fresh, well prepared dishes with lots of veggies and nothing drowning in sauce. I, for one, will be back.

wrYQNuVmuFAQpd1G78kXew.text: Great food, great service and amazing views! All great Italian fusions. Cool atmosphere inside but the terrace is unbeatable with a stunning view of London bridge.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Super Greens Salad

stvsjy73cf8WgWXXumL2fA.text: We visited for dinner and were immediately seated. The beer and drink prices were reasonable and the service was very cheerful and accommodating. The food was good though not exceptional.  The location is very nice on the Thames. The restaurant has a good vibe.

Wqoqazc0LYr5si3isCYQzg.text: Delicious food! Also love the igloos that pop up during Christmas time! You can keep warm inside these gorgeous igloo globes while enjoying an amazing view of the London Bridge.

MWA5TV5llqGI9RS62z09hA.text: Worst service ever. We came for the igloos. On the website, they advertise that you can walk in and share igloos. We saw not only two igloos but also ones with open tables in them. We sat down inside instead and were not asked what we would like to order for at least 15 minutes. I asked for a bowl of fruit and she said she would have to check if they could accommodate that because they only served it for lunch. My friend's food came out and she had finished and we still waited for my bowl of fruit. No apologies and we have only seen our waitress twice. Will never be returning.

ek839F0wxYV1ftHFloBuig.text: Very bad customer service! Rude and careless staffs. Also wouldn't recommend for people with trypophobia, their plates have weird patterns that ruins your appetite:/ Two stars for the foods and drinks.

kZyQ96LMVkZkWwI1R8_vAw.text: Great ambience and good food (smaller portions, but this is coming from an American). I was turned off by the hostess though. The girl in front of us was waiting for a friend and the hostess didn't seat us until the girl and friend got there. We asked for a cabana, which there were at least 5 tables open, and she said they were reserved. We finished and left and didn't see anyone else sit there. The cabanas were the best part, so that was a disappointing.

UWq9dUGWS8z7mXkOo1zOXg.text: My boyfriend and I visited this restaurant on Saturday night. We were hoping to get into the famous Igloos but there was a 3 hour wait for them. At the moment they said that they are not taking any bookings for the Igloos. Anyways they gave us a really nice table with a really good view. Very friendly and professional staff. They were extremely busy but still managed. I think they need to employ a few more waiters. The food and atmosphere was great. My starter - king prawns was absolutely delicious. Very big portions as well.

wO7NNg8edYvNu4bxbiSaNA.text: Super disappointing. My friend and I had been planning our trip to London for 6 months and this place was high on our brunch list as we looked forward to having breakfast in the cabanas. We get there and while most of the cabanas were open upon our 9:30am (on a Wednesday) arrival we were told that we had to sit in other seating as those cabanas were reserved. People came and went and all were sat in the cabanas despite having no reservations for those seats (im positive they did not). the manager was flustered a little rude and forced several people to move upon seating themselves in cabanas. but after a while she gave up and let people sit where they wanted in the cabanas. We left at 11:00 and the 'reservation party' never appeared to show up. Rude and curt service...upon returning to London we will not be coming back here- the breakfast wasn't even close to being worth the disappointing experience.

FbdRQflC9Gv4ATIA8EHcpw.text: Brilliant service! Excellent food too. It was a cloudy and slightly rainy day but the large umbrellas made dining on the terrace still possible! Miles was the best waiter I've had in any country in a very long time! Made the experience perfect! Will definitely come back next time we are near Tower of London.

jE5lha5WAyaZSSi9DCbuEg.text: Awesome food, fresh, tasty, clean, gourmet food. I am impressed. Maria was a great waitress, very helpful, nice and happy

99mg3i8Y9dvJvbY9Hir3yQ.text: Had a nice lunch here a few days ago. The location and view are terrific. Service was great. Food was above average for this touristy area. We will likely have lunch again here this week if we're in the Tower Bridge area

TwbWOekolt3JSROI_EzL7g.text: We were fortunate enough to dine for breakfast in one of the "snowglobe igloos". They were comfortable and heated. Service was fast and friendly. Prices reasonable for four people. Enjoyed the avocado mash, salmon and eggs, pancakes and smoothie with croissant. Dining room looks relaxing and modern. Would return again for the novelty of the igloos.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Igloo!

OcJW06XiK8V7Z9THwgHUOQ.text: Very cool restaurant and bar. My family was served quickly and given the option of sitting in one of the igloos.The only complaint I have was that the Full Breakfast had toast instead of fried bread.

DA9S6UVeBxYMSesLScuixQ.text: Dinner in an Igloo? Count me in! My husband and I discovered Coppa when we decided to venture off to get a nice shot of the Tower Bridge and noticed that there were Igloos and people eating in them! We knew right away that we had to experience this since it's our first time visiting in London! We decided to come back two hours later only to be told that the Igloos were all booked for the night. However, by the luck of God, the booking was cancelled and we were able to be seated in one of the Igloos! Yay, us! We were not that hungry to begin with so we ordered a couple of tapas to share. They were amazing, by far the best food I've had in London! We ordered the fried squid, king prawn, full sourdough bread and a maple bourbon drink. Everything was delicious! Great way to end our last night in London! Thank you, Coppa Club!

zxTF1smXg11FdLJY2eslAQ.text: Coppa Club aka Nope-a Club!We were seated right away on a Saturday night at about 9pm (didn't expect much of a wait for a later service anyhow). Didn't make reservations so didn't sit in the igloos. Our server greeted us with a bottle of water and a joke and asked us where we were from. He gave us some time to take our order. Took our order, still seemed amicable. And then after a bit the bartender brought over our drinks and our starters arrived. Our main courses arrived almost 30 min after we received our starters and the rib eye I ordered to be medium rare was well done. I don't normally send it back, but we were celebrating my birthday and I thought I deserved a steak done how I liked it on my birthday! So I asked our server and he apologized and sent it back. Meanwhile, my sister finished her entree (crab linguine - not too bad). And I ate some of the house salad I ordered as a side. Avocados were passably ripe and some of the lettuce was past it's freshness (we could tell even in the dim light!) While waiting for food, I saw a server lift up another colleague ... just casually carried her sideways and talking with another colleague as she was dangling there. Later on she went to address a table next to us and bent over the table ... guess who was trying to eat her starter with a derrière next to her (yours truly). And we observed our server running around all stressed. We also overheard conversation about crying patrons and witnessed a lady complaining to a server. It seems tensions were high with the staff and there might've even been issues with servers taking each other's tables? That was our best guess. It's like everywhere we looked, there was drama unfolding which really took away from our service. It ended up becoming quite entertaining though. Food tasted mediocre by the time it arrived and I can't say anything particularly remarkable about it.  Oh! For you drama lovers - we didn't know the actual story behind the complaining lady but she talked to multiple staff and we eventually saw the doorman/security walk with her. Our server came to ask us if we were done eating and he seemed frustrated so we didn't ask him for the dessert menu, and to be honest, by then I wanted to have it elsewhere anyway, if that meant salvaging a very underwhelming birthday. I wasn't mad at our server as he got seemingly distracted and visibly frustrated as the night when on, I actually felt terrible. Coppa gets 1 point for effort, but 0.5 for execution and I'll give them 1 for food.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. House salad... the barely ripe avocados and bad lettuce was hidden under the fresher lettuce on top. Lol.

TItLgiNbWcH4Yla8wHEZCQ.text: What an awesome restaurant! We went here due to the views of the London Bridge and were shocked by the excellent food as well as the service. We wanted so badly to stay in one of the outdoor igloos, however, they are fully booked until 2018. I will certainly be back on my next trip to London.

fKtK1lDsebT-wadc8xSt6g.text: One sleepy morning during our visit to London, we walked down to the river and visited the Coppa Club before heading over to the Tower of London.  A very fancy-looking interior belied the casual nature of the eatery.  Not too busy, so we were seated immediately.  I ordered the English Breakfast: eggs, sausage, "streaky" bacon (otherwise known as "American Bacon" - plain old "bacon" in England is Canadian Bacon), baked beans, toast, and black pudding.  Lots of food, very filling and tasty.  The rest of the family had pancakes and bacon, avocado toast, and eggs benedict.  Everyone was satisfied.  I would recommend Coppa Club for breakfast anytime.

ulPkBT4TdAfuv0aCWvq84w.text: Do not go here! They cheat you on the drinks, service is horrendous and they charge the service fee and ask for tips without telling you! Very shady the place left a bad taste in my mouth!

2Wws2QNeyckZIEySDSvOQA.text: Had two visits to the Coppa Club so far (a monday and a friday), and will definitely be returning. Very stylish looking place overlooking the river, gorgeous views (especially if you can nab a seat outdoors or by the large windows). Quality of food & drinks were top notch and reasonably priced for the City. Complimentary water regularly topped up too. Surprisingly, the bar wasn't too packed despite being a great location for both city workers and tourists (though I'd still recommend booking if there's a big group of you). The service upbeat and friendly, the only downside being that the drinks occasionally took a while to come out - I assume because the cocktails are popular and the bartenders take their time over them.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Sunny and peaceful lager by the river

SrqOMPI9jEFlwKwiJISG2A.text: Brunch with the boys has never been so magical  From the breakfast margaritas and Americanos to the eggs benedicts and pasta carbonara, it was nothing but pure elegance. Group morale is at an all time high. This London trip has been an emotional roller coaster but thanks to Coppa we are all happy as a hippo. We were a big fan of the staff and the ambience of the restaurant. It's conveniently located next to the Tower of London and all kinds of other great British things. Prices were not bad at all for such a great place. The eggs Benedict on the salmon though  probably my new favorite breakfast item. So tasty, fam! I wouldn't lie to you. Strongly recommend

PbYktPGA_gykkhApkb8GrA.text: Nice modern gentleman club feel inside and good view and seating outside.This is only a coffee review, I didn't end up trying the food but the plates coming out looked good. :)Flat white: Serving staff: they were very kind and helpful also they made sure we had water on our table all time so we stay hydrated. Bad point: we waited close to 20 minutes for the bill, it would be great if they would have mobile app payment solution! (Like PandaPay)

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

M6zjt11dzm2YOvl0xcO8AQ.text: Best place for a dinner/night out in London so far. The food, service and the staff were good. Prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is so nice you won't want to get up from the hut .

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

tQdiN3yzK3Q2odkf2RMtTw.text: Nice place, good ambiance, however, the staff seems to attempt to project themselves as a bit pretentious, and the alcohol selection is very limited. The food is decent, and I would eat here again.  Reserve the great view from the outdoor igloo seating.  Also good to mention that the igloo seating is a several hour wait, so reserve it earlier in the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

BS2X-oiySkjPCQELK8cDVA.text: Came here on vacation and I was able to get a seat with a view of Tower Bridge.  The food was delicious, I had the chicken liver and super green salad I believe.  The only reason why It's not 5 stars is the service was extremely slow and I couldn't get a box for "take away"  But if you want to have a drink a long the river, some good food with an amazing view then this is the  spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. New Iced Coffee and great view!
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Super Green Salad
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Liver Toast

gp-mlfL3uGsstFDMgc_s5A.text: Pros: We were able to get a table inside quickly even without a reservation (if you want an igloo, you definitely need a reservation). Our waiter was also very friendly and helpful. Cons: I had severe dietary restrictions and made this clear to the waiter. Him and I discussed what the kitchen could make that I could eat. He even went back to the kitchen twice to remind them. When my dish was brought out (about 30-40 minutes later), an extra five ingredients (some of which I specifically stated I could not eat) had been added. I also found the restaurant to be fairly expensive and loud. I give it two stars instead of one because of the waiter and ability to get a table, but all in all, much more attention should've been paid to my food, and we ended up having to leave because of this because we didn't have time for it to be remade.

b-u-X6xfC2CogEf2AYBw9g.text: It's right on the water. The waitstaff is awesome. Food is good. I was really pleased.

HLnk2UylxlK2g_4k1qU06w.text: The restaurant was great except for the food. It's a cozy atmosphere with excellent service and beautiful view.  We ordered many different things. Pasta, Pizza, trout....really bland and boring. Still, we had a great night. Except for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

d35S_hAvxjKc_7eKDm3T7Q.text: We ate lunch at the bar and even though they indicated there might be an additional wait for the food, there was no delay. The food was very good. We had the marghertia pizza and the crust was the perfect blend of chewy and flavorful despite being a thin crust. The salad we ordered was fresh with just the amount of dressing. And the view of the bridge and river was the perfect backdrop.

dx1gzoBLW18BApNE0QPs3w.text: After three attempts at reserving the staff finally figured out they may be incompetent. Food awful, staff idiotic. What a waste of a good spot. The manager who'd rather remain out of sight was grateful that we walked out after trying this place again. I couldn't criticise this place enough.

z0UPSjN5N6OjjCCqi_o3nQ.text: The Coppa Club, just below our hotel is a nice, modern restaurant with great food.The furniture and the interior are modern and overthought; The colors of blue, rosé and olive green play good together, and even though it gets loud in the evening the restaurant does have a nice atmosphere. The service is fast and very friendly and if one has questions they can answer every single one. The food was delicious; but for my purposes and that's to be fed up, the portions were definitely too small. Wich is why we ordered a desert. The cheese cake was delicious and after that, one could say that that was definitely the highlight on this evening. Nevertheless, there is something I criticize; If you'd want to make a reservation for the evening, you couldn't because they are not used to pick up the phone. And when we arrived these wonderful looking igloos with a gorgeous Thames view were already filled with people.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

sk0QLuplfjZNbAutJrxyCQ.text: Excellent dinner!! We had a short wait, we opted to try to walk in and see what they had available as all the reservations were booked. We were told it would be about an hour but only took about 15 minutes and would have been worth the hour wait!! The food was delicious. We started with the bruschetta and the hummus. I highly recommend it!

XSOcSDPfA7LdXDG4uztufA.text: Great tourist place.  Sat outside under the clear domes with fur covered seats and blankets.  They were also heated.  Had the British sirloin with fries.  It was cooked well and tasted fine.  Cider was great.  Had sticky toffee pudding for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

8-l1p-31Mqs84iJ5yknvrA.text: This place was worth for 4 stars due to the great location It's next to the tower bridge and with great views.  With the food it could be 3.5 but I don't have the option. The service was pretty good but again the food wasn't that amazing as well. Is that true the food not one of the attractions in UK?I had the rib eye steak and it was a little chewy. I like the patio but they didn't have heaters at the patio?? I noticed they might provide the blanket but who want to use the blanket that other ppl used?Overall, this place still worth to go due to the great views.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Grilled veg

1tVyE956eSFqud67m6Md1A.text: Skating at the ice rink or sightseeing at the Tower of London? If you find yourself by this historic landmark, I recommend sauntering over for a cozy bite to eat!Situated a few buildings away from the Tower of London and right by the riverside, the Coppa Club is a prime location to dine while enjoying the sights. They even have these clear hemisphere shaped pods for outside seating that instantly draw your attention and envy--although I imagine the people inside might feel like they are on display or animals at a zoo exhibit. Anyway, those pods were all reserved when we talked to the greeter, so call early if you want to eat in one of those!There was no line when we went in on a weekend night although there was a fair amount of people inside. The place seems spacious, with a bar area as well as traditional dining area. Stepping out of the biting cold, we were taken to the back and quickly got settled.With your typical fare, salads, pasta, steak, fish, etc, I ordered the trout. Our server wasn't particularly helpful in the decision process nor did he seem particularly cordial or patient.The food took a bit of time to arrive but wasn't too long that I noticed the time passing. Being the uncultured fish connoisseur that I am, I was surprised when I took a bite of it and thought it tasted exactly like salmon! Guess I can't really taste the difference.I thought the trout was satisfactorily tender and the skin was perfectly crispy. The citrus flavor from the orange was a great touch, and the side of couscous (or some thing resembling that) was a great pairing. My only complaint was that I wish the portion size was a bit bigger. I guess you should probably order an appetizer too if you come here.I would recommend booking the outside pod dining experience if you know you will be around the tower bridge area!

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Recommend the trout!

Fguu9QFBotWtGbSCQEkVIA.text: I think this this the best breakfast and brunch I ever have..if not the location if too far out...if would go back every weeks. Lovely interior design decorated with bar and open kitchen style. Exterior South facing terrace seating area given you the best views of London Bridge and river Thames. The restaurant served wide range selection of breakfast, brunch, wine, beer and cocktails. The breakfast taste good and the price is reasonable. I would go to try again on the difference menu if I'm down that area.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

6rEkOhyMrRdAbzr82v77Gg.text: Quick lunch before going to London Towers...not impressed, the outside ambiance was very inviting though...the ONLY thing on the menu that spoke to me was the coppa burger which was aged beef.  I don't know if it's because I'm American and used too the processing but this burger had a weird smell and taste to me.  We were sort of in a hurry so we asked if we could get it rather quickly and they obliged but my burger didn't have lettuce or anything when the only thing I said I didn't want was tomato.  My friend enjoyed her chicken breast and the other had a salad.  The fries were thin and didn't seem fresh.  Our waiter, Lucas was nice but sort of soft spoken for such a loud place.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Aged beef coppa burger

oiIo5SU7Cg0WOflvM81RCQ.text: So beautiful in the summer for brunch outdoors looking over the Thames and tower bridgeWe turned up on the day and managed to get two seats in the igloos outside, however I'd recommend to book ahead if you're really precious about getting in them

eqLL_zmqtJiMvbeRvP3PNw.text: Out for a walk along the Thames I came across the Coppa Club and had to have a bite and a beer since the area was so picturesque.After ordering some Sticky Chorizo Sausage and Crispy Fried Truffled Gnocchi and then a beer on the Terrace I sat down to watch the world go by, people watch and enjoy life.I couldn't have picked a better place.The staff was nice, the food was good and the view for people watching next to the Tower of London was excellent.If what I had was a good example for the rest of the food, I can't imagine anything here being less than great. I would have gone back if I'd had the chance and my stay had been longer.Sit outside and enjoy the view. It's lovely.

ikwkok0kHT0BkMVaFH7mGA.text: Food is great here! Some of the best fries I've ever had. Coffee pudding was scrumptious. Overall, I would come back for a meal. The service is not the best though. You will be left waiting a lot. The service was awkward. Not very attentive.

sKUOKmScLFyW5S7AhhQAWQ.text: I'm confused if people were paid to give this place higher ratings or if I just came on a really really off-day for Copa.2 stars for the service. There were easily 8+ people walking around (4 tending to the bar alone where no customers sat) yet the poor host was greeting/seating guests, taking orders, checking in on tables etc. They get 2 stars instead of one because everyone was very friendly.Food. Two stars. My boyfriend said his favorite thing about the hash was the beans (sad) and my dish was...meh. I'm not sure how you mess up avocado toast but it was disappointing.Atmosphere. 4 stars. Cute decor but I dont think its worth staying for a meal.

cdipIkWx4EY-ZPHgU-iicw.text: Please try another place. Place looks very nice from the outside, nice cabanas in the court yard and service was attentive. Food was n

crnLfBt5bT-jZW0i5GFlhQ.text: Our first breakfast in London. It was OK. Given the reviews, we had hoped for better.Clearly, Coppa Club is very popular. Another way to say this: It's loud, it takes a while to get a table, and it's crowded. The service was pretty slow. The food came out cold, the tea arrived well after the food. They seated us right near the door, which was less than ideal, as it was frigid outside. All told, it was a generally lousy experience. Not horrible, but not good either.Sorry Coppa, a cold, slow, 2 stars.

j2ucpPeVh3Q4NVqCaFJz3g.text: Traveling alone is difficult enough, and unfortunately this restaurant decided to add to the headache. On a Thursday evening I walked up to Coppa and asked if there were any seats available at the bar for one. He hostess said no, then said 'well you can just get a drink', THEN said 'and maybe some nibbles'. When I told her this was fine with me, she said 'well maybe they will serve you a burger or something'. It was the oddest welcome I have ever had at a restaurant! When I assured her this would work for me, she moved to the side and said 'well come in then'. I felt as though I had been through some kind of initiation process. I found a single seat at the bar, and the bartender came over quick enough given how busy they were. I ordered a glass of wine and asked for a food menu for the bar. He said the entire menu was available, which was quite confusing given my experience with the hostess. Anyway, I ordered the crab and avocado appetizer (surprisingly different than what I was hoping for) and the super greens salad (great!). The bartender automatically served me the larger glass of wine (yay?) so would recommend future diners tell them the size they would like up front. Overall, I don't know I will be back. Even if I were there with my usual entourage, I'd rather patronage a restaurant that treats their customers well.

O0-HXEYCFK54PC03fzYnAQ.text: Unimpressed. Waited months for a cabanna reservation and was crammed in with  3 other tables, would have rather eaten inside. Sirloin was not flavorful and fatty. Service was slow. Atmosphere and views were the only thing bringing this review up to a 3. Prices were good other than iced down Old Fashioned.

0XfP-IMSnU1ykhPcztZqFw.text: I went there for a brunch and the food was meh. I ordered a salad and there was so little ingredients and no sauce (!!)... it was looking very sad. And my partner dish was also very average. You really come here for the decoration!

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

sNHlfCEVHZh1hQGgg5BoEQ.text: The service was nice and the restaurant was beautiful. Other then that I have nothing good to say. The food was horribly cooked. Both my father and I got burgers with fries. Both burgers were completely burnt. His fries were also burnt, however mine were not, which shows obvious inconsistency. We went there because it was crowded, which usually means people like it and it is therefore a good place. After our meal we payed closer attention and realized the only people there were tourists, probably lured in by awesome decorations.

draaesZnBL4ClJ5FmDNdKw.text: Enjoyed a late lunch here after visiting the Tower of London. My wife and I split a pasta dish and a pizza, just right to cover lunch but not spoil our appetite for afternoon tea a few hours later .The igloos seem to have been replaced with a row of cabanas along the river walk. Each is shielded in plastic with lights and a heat lamp, and an open side towards the restaurant. Each cabana has one, two, or three tables depending on sizes.A great spot to sit and watch the river walk traffic go by.

1Kcpajl4F8V31mTm4CyhZw.text: Went in for a late lunch 2:15p on a Saturday. Very busy but staff was very friendly and accommodating. Seated and served within 25 minutes total. Food tasted good and portions were respectable in size. Seating was decent amount of spacing which helped since it was quite crowded and loud. Our service was great and got us everything we needed along with getting done in time to catch the next boat ride. Good location to eat if your taking the boat ride down the Thames and stopping at the London Tower pier.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Margherita pizza
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Poached egg and smashed avocado toast

yFzSCMMJYKCbicFCIuAqzQ.text: The waiter kept insisting that we get the fish stu special and I am so glad that we did. It was really delicious. I am just sad that we didn't get a bubble seat.

5dOiOz-t52uZhWy9R9yrDg.text: Wonderful Italian/European food served in a beautiful setting overlooking Tower Bridge.

KTNKEqO_oA5jXChs2ezBvA.text: I initially found this place due to the Igloos having an amazing view of the London Bridge. However, you have to book those in advance. I made a reservation for this restaurant a week in advance for brunch. This brunch was the absolute best I had all trip especially for the price. I ordered the breakfast with eggs, chorizo, and kale. IT WAS AMAZING. Great food, location and price.

N5kubR_vBJLRZ3Zkb3ZoJg.text: I moved to London - woo hoo! This was my first brunch in the city. A friend and I headed here and honestly, I was surprised at how good it was. I found out about this place on Instagram (follow my journies @briyoumetravel) and was enticed by its cute little igloos and tropical paradise vibes. However, the food was actually quite tasty, the service was normal and the prices were excellent. It's in quite a touristy location (you can see tower bridge from here) and is located right on the River Thames. I thought the location would mean overpriced, mediocre food and I was wrong! Brunch for two costed 35 pounds! We ordered:- Mimosas (4.00)- Pancakes with bacon (6.95)- English Breakfast (9.45)Don't skip this place! #YouMeTravel #YouMeLunchKeep up with my food & travel adventures - instagram.com/briyoumetr…youmelunch.com

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. So good and affordable!  Coppa Club by @briyoumetravel
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Coppa Club by @briyoumetravel
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Coppa Club by @briyoumetravel

0wEae_NCt0H4Hm6ejpm4Og.text: I came here in March of last year and I saw the dining igloos outside, and thus I ran in to try and get a seat inside an igloo. Unfortunately, that would take an hour or two, and because I was starving, I had to take the next best seat in this restaurant... the seat next to the window where I could watch others dine inside the igloo. The view is amazing, I watched London Bridge the entire time that I was not watching the igloos. The service is amazing and the servers were attentive. I ordered the steak and that is the best recommendation I can make. I really enjoyed my steak. Though the portion was small, they did sprinkle some greens on top. This was an amazing spot to eat at. The view, the food, everything was worth the experience. Almost felt magical. See pic.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

MHnyrc5n5t5ip9b3WJSQQQ.text: We managed to get a reservation at one of the pods last week during breakfast time! We assumed it was a rooftop restaurant based on what we read in one of the articles off of social media but we were wrong. Doesn't make the place any less great. I ordered their smoothie along with their pancakes and bacon. The smoothie was delicious and refreshing for a hot morning. The maple syrup was divine. The plate came out hot and every bite I savored. It looked like a small dish but it was very filling. It does get hot in the pod if there's no breeze and the sun is shining on you. So...you've been warned.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

keBvTqU1bMojsOqIPJH7lg.text: We stopped here for a late breakfast after having seen it a few days before. We decided to go skip the igloos, since they stuff eight people 4x2 in there. Took away some of the atmosphere to squeeze so many parties in a small igloo.The food was really good, fresh and well made. Had smashed avocado and poached eggs on toast, and it was lovely! My boyfriend loved the granola.It took quite some time to get the food, so that's why it's not a five, but I would definitely go back! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Smashed avocado and poached eggs on toast.

kl6dEcPR5E-b5I__mnNepQ.text: You come to Coppa Club for the views of London and to dine in these cool pods. Although many recommended making reservations, I was iffy since they took down a deposit. Instead, we took our chances with a walk-in for brunch at 9/10am in the morning. With our luck, the four of us were led into one of the pods shared with another table of two. Even with our luggages in hand, we were able to fit comfortably inside. Coppa Club has the best aesthetics going on from the palm leaves hanging above the pods to the silverware on the table.Since it was my last meal in London, I decided to opt for the English Skillet Breakfast (£9.45) and a Lean Green Juice (£5.45). I felt like I needed some veggies and energy, so the green juice helped. As for the English breakfast, it consisted of two fried eggs, sausage, dry cured streaky bacon, Spanish black pudding, field mushrooms, roast tomato, Heinz baked beans, and toast. I wasn't a huge fan of all the ingredients on the plate to begin with and trying this dish only reconfirmed it for me. I'm not mad since I really wanted to try the English baked beans that London is so well-known for. Despite that, the meal was still pleasant; but the Waffle Benedicts (£8.45) that the rest of the table ordered were very tasty. Overall, pretty place with London views in a igloo pod.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Coppa Waffle Benedict.
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Salmon Waffle Benedict.
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Lean Green Juice.

XXW9yCft4BhwPeM_Q9wX5w.text: I made these reservations almost 2 months before traveling to London and they were worth it all!! When traveling with an Executive Chef & 2 picky eater they ALL said how amazing the food was. On top of the atmosphere was fantastic. If your in London or visiting. Do yourself a favor make reservations right after booking your flights. But don't take a cab like we did he made us late!!

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

c8VwSiSGYC-43nE6eNkU7A.text: This place is amazing. Great food - and priced very cheap! Friends and I made reservations weeks ahead. We had dinner under one of the canopy/igloo huts. The view and setting was amazing. Overlooks the river and the tower bridge. Our server Abdul did a phenomenal job serving us. He even surprised one of my friends with a slice of pie with a candle for her birthday.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Flash steak with fries! So good!
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

CDkc8bJEExMs49Itlb8QJQ.text: I absolutely loved Coppa Club when I had lunch there last week. I would recommend making a reservation in advance and asking to be seated in one of the igloos outside that sits out on the water (make note that these are shared igloos so you won't have a lot of privacy)! The restaurant itself is quite large so we were able to be seated inside right away with no reservation. Coppa Club is located in a very central location of the city, right next to the Tower of London and about a 5-10 minute walk to Tower Bridge. They offer a wide variety of food options. We started with the bruschetta which was so-so and then had a burger and a margherita pizza. The pizza was delicious and had amazingly thin crust! We finished out meal with the apple rhubarb tart which was very flavorful and flaky. It clearly was made to order!Overall, I would definitely recommend Coppa Club but beware that this is not a restaurant where you will have that quick of service. We ended up staying for a little over an hour and a half which we did not expect to happen but we are also Americans who expect things to happen a lot quicker than normal!

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

dm6ANwv3MLMXkZ_S7qVLYQ.text: You must reservation in advance for paradise pot, it is really cute!!!! The best photo spot. Food is normal, not bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

beaibXj-S79Zn5RUjEHfUg.text: We stopped in here for a drink while debating on attending the BBC Good Food Feast at Tower of London. Both the interior and exterior of the building are beautifully designed, clean, and inviting. We grabbed drinks from the bar and a seat outside with a great view of the Tower Bridge.  Michael had the best Espresso Martini that I had ever tasted. I had a very refreshing Elderflower & Passion Fruit Spritz that went down a little too nicely.  The next time I go back I'm 100% sitting and dining in one of the cabanas.  They are so beautiful!

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

hoCEBAN6rZzntMpUyPogIQ.text: Zero star. Horrible customer service. We showed up for an igloo and were told that we would get one after 3 hrs of wait. We returned right after 3 hrs and were told to wait another hr even though they had some spots available. We got a vibe that they didn't want us sharing the igloo with other group because we had a toddler with us.

D-OkGStWUxHgVqrEWWntbQ.text: Last night I went to Coppa Club with a group of friends to experience the glass igloos. The igloos themselves are quite cute, warm and make for a lovely evening. The service of the restaurant however was quite terrible. When we were seated we were told that approx 5-6 menu items were not available. The way we were told is that the waiter took a pen and crossed items off of a paper menu, there was no apology or no suggestion of other items to order. I asked the waiter how good the food was and the response I got was "ehhhh." It was clear from the beginning that we were not off to a good start. When it came time to order our mains one member of our party ordered the trout. He was then told after everyone ordered that they were out of trout and more menu items. Another member of our party is Vegan and was told that the vegan item on the menu was out of stock. They made an accommodation by allowing her to get the vegan burger without a bun (as the bun was not vegan). When her meal came it legitimately just a patty. There was no side, no sauce or no toppings, it was fairly pathetic. Another of my friends ordered the carbonera and was told that it wasn't real authentic carbonera. When the food was delivered the waitress dropping it off was clearly uninterested in providing us with service. The food itself was good. Finally when the end of the night came the hostess barged into our igloo and instead of politely asking us to leave and stating that they had closed she exclaimed very rudely that they were closed, we had to leave and they did not have a licence allowing us to there. Mentioning their lack of licence seemed fairly aggressive and absolutely unnecessary considering we had not intention of staying on. This was also particularly interesting considering that when we left the staff were cheering, drinking and getting ready to party. As a result one must ask whether they wanted us to leave due to their lack of licensing requirements or because they wanted to have a staff party. Either way it was quite disappointing. All in all, the glass igloos are a nice experience but this the staff of their restaurant could do with a lesson in customer service.

RV-rge9p101oDm1PSvXYpA.text: Good location with great views and friendly service.  Not good food.  The burger was ok, but the seafood pasta was really bad.

56rxIxoPZyWbR0j2EMiI_g.text: The location, ambience, and stunning view of the Tower Bridge earns this business any stars. Seriously...the dripping Wisteria from the pergolas are enough to stop and sip on some vino while copping the perfect backdrop for your next snapshot. The food and service, on the other hand, leaves much to be desired. I ordered the crispy fried squid and the Flash Steak and Fries. I was impressed by neither.  Both bland and made me want to ask for hot sauce...something I don't typically do, nor did I. London has been a stunning place to visit, but I've yet to dine in an establishment that knocks my socks off...this one included. Tragic. Service was lackluster as well. There were two other tables around us who also seemed frustrated with the lack of presence from the staff. One customer finally got up to find their server as the other severs scoffed. Not impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

NKq3M-iaEyzh0iJ4P1Mmvg.text: I really love dining here, as they have a lovely outside space overlooking the Thames.  However, they have just changed their setting from igloos to cabanas a couple of days ago, and an outside bar.  So looked to check it out for lunch.Looks very pretty covered with imitation wisterias and greenery (looks very real), and very comfortable seating with outdoor sofas and wicker armchairs. There is a strip of space heaters above on the structure, but it does not give out much heat, because of the surrounding wisterias, they can only be set as low.  Blankets were also available for the cooler weather, like today, but when the sun peeped out from the cloudy sky, it was very pleasant. It is always nice eating alfresco, and food seems to tastes better.  We started with the sticky chorizo sausages with honey, mustard and smoked paprika glaze, and garlic bread.  All very delicious. Wish the portions were a bit more generous though.  For mains we ordered the flash steak with watercress and skinny fries, and the corn-fed chicken with lemony rosemary juices,house slaw & skinny fries.  The steaks came either medium raw or medium well done, although when you asked for medium well done, it came medium raw!  As steaks go, it was not particularly tasty, very average.  The chicken, however, was really succulent, tender and very tasty. Do try their Homemade Berry Lemonade with cherry puree, blueberry & blackcurrant cordial, fresh lime and lemonade, or their Orange and Passion Fruit Cooler, with passion fruit, lime,freshly squeezed orange which is very tangy and refreshing but I thought too much ice, and not enough drink.  However, I much preferred the Elderflower and Mint Limonata with elderflower, fresh lime and mint and soda. A really comfortable and pleasant way to dine, with lovely views, and probably during the summer nights with the night views lit up, the ambiance would probably be even nicer.  Another reason to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Really comfy outdoor dining
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Cabanas overlooking Thames and view of Tower Bridge
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Flash steak, watercress and skinny fries

J3VEN6vC5hqMmQVsonifsw.text: Yummy!!!!! Food is finger licking GOOD!! You need reservations but well worth it. We did lunch and it was great. We were there a bit early n we got a table (in the igloo) early ;) Great view while dining. Great place. Friendly staff

rBnwRfM-AgX3FyVXj-pD1A.text: Decided to check this spot out after reading reviews on yelp prior to our Jack the Ripper tour, it did not disappoint. Luckily we had made a booking online in advance as the restaurant remained busy through the evening. It is so cute and quaint, request the outdoor seating of possible, he view of the tour bridge is stunning in the evening.I ordered a starter of garlic bread which was delicious but not too filling before our mains. My boyfriend had the coppa club hot pizza which was delicious, and I had the carbonara. The sauce was so creamy and it was perfect paired with penne pasta instead of the spaghetti. Will definitely come back, prices were so good for the location too! Not to be missed in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

Xe_Zo3RxnPCuHkK_PsRlhQ.text: Don't miss out on experiencing brunch at this restaurant!!! One of the highlights of our trip. Book a table in a bubble well ahead of time (we got lucky & they had one available). Food was delicious, had fairly healthy options, and was not over-priced considering the ambiance & location. Would recommend to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Coppa Club Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

Ley91zFYmnWKTBsXOFQw4Q.text: Given that Coppa had mixed reviews of great and horrible reviews, I figured might as well give this place a chance. Unfortunately, I made the wrong choice. Thankfully there was no wait so I'm not as upset- no wait for mediocre food and service. However, the night progressively got worse. So it started off with my friends and I ordering food and wine. The first turnoff was when my friend asked to taste the sauv blanc and the waitress said she couldn't because they only go by bottle, yet the menu had an option to order a glass? So we went with another white that she recommended, just to find out it was all sold out. We then decided to go outside for about 5 minutes and even told her we would be right back we were just taking pictures right outside of the restaurant because they have nice view while we wait for the food. As we got back the food came back with no bottle of wine. She then brought us wine tasting option after the fact that there were no more bottles of her recommendation???! So we chose a bottle of wine to pair with our food, but we waited another 5 minutes until the bottle finally showed up. After that we lost sight of our initial waitress for most of the remainder of our time there. So after that fiasco, my friends and I finally had time to just take our time to eat and chat. Mid chat I get interrupted by another server asking if I was ready? Confused I asked excuse me? She then explained that she was asking me if I was done with my food, mind you I had a decent portion left with plenty of wine left. I politely said no I'm still working on it. A few minutes after another server comes up literally interrupting and asking the same thing?! With this horrible service you would hope for at least decent/good food since it had a spectacular view right?! NOPE. We had the bruschetta, fried squid, penne carbonara, and crab linguine. The bruschetta was soggy and bland(how do you mess up on such a simple dish?), the carbonara was also bland, the linguine was dry with no crab pieces, and I guess the fried squid was the most decent out of the bunch(but I've still had better).I normally don't write this much on yelp, but everything about this place (minus the view- sucha waste) was horrendous. BE AWARE.

qSjbXUmZ5dyjWRWjLZuKRg.text: I apologize for the tardiness of the review.  Ate there on Oct. 30,2016. We were a group of 4 and it was the first night of the igloos. We were able to dine in one & it was very cool. Look forward to trying their cabana next. We started with the truffled fried gnocchi. Pretty good but would be better with a touch of truffle salt. Someone else ordered the bruschetta. It was a very small portion. Impossible to share with more than 2 people. I had the nice house salad starter. Loved the avocado in it & dressing was tasty. For my entree I ordered the 1/2 portion of crab linguini. It was delicious and I regretted not ordering full size portion.  We went ahead and ordered some bread to go with our dinners. It is phenomenal. I imagine they make their pizzas from the same dough, so I look forward to going back to try one. We had excellent servers. Very friendly & helpful.
